New Records: Wales are through to the play-off final
Wales have moved from confident to rampant with four minutes of time to play
Key Match Events: GOAL: Wales are off to the races! (Brooks 3')
GOAL: A familiar face reduces the deficit! (Pukki 45')
GOAL: Johnson makes it three for the hosts! (Johnson 47')
A delay... but Wales have their fourth! (D James 86')
Pre-Game Insights: Wales captain Aaron Ramsey named in Rob Page's Euro 2024 play-off squad, despite failing to start a match for SIX MONTHS
Rob Page looks forward in a post-Bale reality
Wales can draw on recent qualification form
Wales might feel a little, little bit nervous
Marvellous statement of intent from the opposition
Post-Match Reflections: WALES ARE THROUGH TO THE PLAY-OFF FINAL
I think the only negative from the night was that we conceded, but when we're scoring four goals, it puts you in a good place, and I think it's a good stepping stone for next week.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Wales have a strong chance here, after Johnson bullies an approaching Finland defender away from the ball on the right edge of the box, and fires silkly towards the near post.
The cards are flying, with Hakans the next to be flashed after going down on the edge of the Wales box with a theatricality Rhys Ifans himself would have been proud of.
